abstract.p: US Postal Service names Asianese Partnership, Bravo Group and Chisholm-Mingo Group to handle multicultural advertising (S)

block.p: After choosing agencies to handle duties involved in mass-market campaigns, the United States Postal Service has selected three New York agencies to handle multicultural advertising. Each has a one-year contract with four one-year options; billings were not disclosed.

The three are the Asianese Partnership; the Bravo Group, part of Young & Rubicam Inc., and the Chisholm-Mingo Group. The agencies specialize in the Asian-American, Spanish-speaking and African-American markets, respectively. Bravo is an incumbent.

After choosing agencies to handle duties involved in mass-market campaigns, the United States Postal Service has selected three New York agencies to handle multicultural advertising. Each has a one-year contract with four one-year options; billings were not disclosed.

The three are the Asianese Partnership; the Bravo Group, part of Young & Rubicam Inc., and the Chisholm-Mingo Group. The agencies specialize in the Asian-American, Spanish-speaking and African-American markets, respectively. Bravo is an incumbent.

Previous campaigns aimed at Asian-American and African-American consumers were handled piecemeal by various agencies. The mass-market assignments were made last week to agencies including the Leo Burnett unit of the B Com3 Group in Chicago.
